intro: Beaufortia, commonly known as the Christmas bush, is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, often showy flowers. The plants typically have leathery, evergreen leaves and are adapted to dry, rocky environments. Beaufortia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in arid conditions. They play an important role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
